TFontValue Class Reference

A color value class which allows to store color values as QFont. More...

#include <iisFontValue.h>

Detailed Description

A color value class which allows to store color values as QFont.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TFontValue::TFontValue ( TValueBrowser *  parent,
const QString &  name,
TFontList *  list = &TFontList::fullFontList(),
int  page = -1,
int  id = -1 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
parent is the TValueBrowser parent (can not be 0).
name is the name of the item (text shown for user).
list is the private list of the static values which can be picked by the user (s_fontList by default).
page is the number of the page the item should be moved (-1 by default, which means the current page).
id is the unique identifier of the item (-1 by default, which means no id).

TFontValue::TFontValue ( TBaseItem *  parent,
const QString &  name,
TFontList *  list = &TFontList::fullFontList(),
int  id = -1 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
parent is the TValueBrowser parent (can not be 0).
name is the name of the item (text shown for user).
list is the private list of static values which can be picked by the user (s_fontList by default).
id is the unique identifier of the item (-1 by default, which means no id).

virtual int TBaseValue::number (  )  const [inline, virtual, inherited]

Casts current item's value to integer. Use this method only if you're sure that value has type of integer, or else result may be unexpected.

virtual double TBaseValue::numberF (  )  const [inline, virtual, inherited]

Casts current item's value to double. Use this method only if you're sure that value has type of double, or else result may be unexpected.

void TBaseValue::setPropertyName ( const QString &  name  )  [inherited]

Sets property name to name. A property name will be used for settings file while TValueBrowser::writeDataSet() or TValueBrowser::readDataSet() is called. If name is empty, no property will be stored/read to/from settings file.

See also:
properyName()

void TBaseValue::setLinked ( void *  linked,
int  type = TValueBrowser::LT_OWNTYPE 
) [inherited]

Sets linked value to linked with type type. If linked is 0 then no linked value will be connected.

void TBaseValue::showChildren ( bool  on = true  )  [inherited]

Shows expandable items if on is true, hides if false. Most common usage is to call this from the parent item's constructor, passing default children state as the parameter.

Since:
3.2

virtual void TBaseValue::doShowChildren ( bool  on  )  [inline, protected, virtual, inherited]

Since:
3.2

void TBaseValue::setChildMode (  )  [inline, protected, inherited]

Marks item as a child (it will be drawn in another color). Normally, it is called from registerChild() and should not be called directly.

Since:
3.2

void TBaseItem::setCheckPropertyName ( const QString &  name  )  [inherited]

Sets check property name to name. This name will be used for settings file while TValueBrowser::writeDataSet() or TValueBrowser::readDataSet() is called, to store item's check state. If name is empty, no check property will be stored/read to/from settings file.

See also:
checkProperyName(), addCheckProperty()

const QString& TBaseItem::checkProperyName (  )  const [inline, inherited]

Reads check property name.

See also:
setCheckPropertyName(), addCheckProperty()

void TBaseItem::setCheckLinked ( void *  linked,
int  type = TValueBrowser::LT_BOOL 
) [inherited]

Sets linked value for check flag to linked, and type to type. If linked is 0 then no linked value will be connected with check.

See also:
addCheckProperty()

void TBaseItem::addCheckProperty ( const QString &  name = QString::null,
void *  linked = 0,
int  type = TValueBrowser::LT_BOOL 
) [inherited]

Quick method to enable check state, set check property name to name, linked value to linked, and type to type.

See also:
setCheckLinked(), checkProperyName(), setCheckPropertyName()

bool TBaseItem::setItemLevel ( int  level = 0  )  [inherited]

Sets level of the item to level. This is need to be used for own values only, followed with quick-added children.

virtual void TBaseItem::onChangeItem ( int   )  [protected, virtual, inherited]

Called internally when the item changes.

Since:
3.2

virtual int TBaseItem::iconSpace (  )  const [inline, protected, virtual, inherited]

Returns size between icon and editor line. Sometimes should be reimplemented in subclasses in order to provide correct distance.
